author: @RealMcDudu
text: FYI - you don't always have to ask to "read" the file you opened. It's actually faster to iterate over a file object that is not "read".   l = open('file','r') for line in l:     pass (or code)  is much faster than   l = open('file','r') for line in l.read() / l.readlines()    pass (or code)  the 2nd one will be 1.5x more expansive time-wise.
